alert.note: Alert for Licking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 22 at 8:45PM EST until February 23 at 4:11AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers... Raccoon Creek near Granville. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Raccoon Creek near Granville. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Portions of the TJ Evans bike trail are nearly flooded, with out buildings near the Granville Water Plant flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 13.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM EST Tuesday was 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 4.6 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to developments by listening to NOAA Weather Radio. For additional details on river forecasts, visit water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=iln
